A pesar de ser el mismo modo de juego, no aburre por la gran variedad de asesinos, mapas y supervivientes a elegir. Los puntos negativos son la toxicidad que hay en los chats al final de las partidas y que se requiere de muchísimas horas para poder conseguir más personajes.

Um dos poucos Survival Horrors que gosto! A Gameplay é divertida e o fator replay é muito bom! Vários personagens a serem desbloqueados com diferentes "Perks" (Habilidades). A monetização é aceitável, poucos são os personagens que não podem ser adquiridos gratuitamente, o jogo sobrevive majoritariamente através de itens COSMÉTICOS. O jogo carece de diferentes modos de jogo e os eventos poderiam ser melhores.

Bon bah voilà, au bout de 700 heures, je pense sincèrement avoir fait le tour du contenu de ce jeu.
J'ai grandement apprécié le jeu au début lors de l'apprentissage des compétences, des mécaniques et la maîtrise à long terme de ces deux points. 
Mais désormais, de nombreux aspects du jeu m'irrite comme : 

- [b] Le Matchmaking. [/b] Depuis quelques mois, les développeurs ont eu la soudaine idée d'appliquer un matchmaking basé sur le skill, d'où le nom "SBMM". Sur le coup, il n'y a rien d'alarmant. Le problème, c'est que le temps d'attente, qui était déjà assez long et chiant, est encore plus long et chiant. Ils arrivent à rendre pire la situation, si ça ce n'est pas génial ! On tombe aussi sur les mêmes personnes vu que le MMR trie les joueurs donc si on tombe sur des toxiques, c'est la boucle ! Et puis c'est censé se baser sur le skill, hmm j'en doute fort car le nombre de joueurs incapables de réparer un générateur sans louper un test ou qui ne veulent pas jouer (WTF !?) que je croise est affolant. [u] Donc le MMR, c'est non. [/u]

- [b] L'équilibrage. [/b] En effet, l'équilibrage des deux camps (Survivant, Tueur) est à la ramasse. Par exemple, les survivants ont la capacité d'annuler les compétences de sorts des Tueurs en purifiant le totem associé (la compétence sera donc annulée de la partie actuelle). À l'inverse, le Tueur peut annuler les compétences de bénédiction des Survivants en "éteignant" le totem associé (la compétence peut donc être réactivé sur le même totem). Vous voyez le problème ?
L'équilibrage des compétences, c'est pareil. Un lot de 6-7 compétences revient à chaque partie au niveau des deux camps. C'est dommage parce que le jeu propose une multitude de compétences mais certaines sont vraiment faibles ou même inutiles alors que d'autres sont utilisées à chaque partie. Des compétences sont parfois pétées et sont réajustées un mois plus tard, c'est donc vite chiant.

- [b] Les bugs. [/b] D'accord, il y a en a dans tous les jeux mais là, ce n'est juste pas possible. Des bugs de collision, des bugs au niveau des menus, des bugs sonores, des bugs visuelles etc. Et pour qu'ils soient corrigés, il faut être patient et encore, certains sont toujours présents depuis un bon bout de temps.

- [b] BVHR en personne. [/b] Je me demande sincèrement si les développeurs nous écoutent. Pour sortir du contenu qui n'est pas nécessaire ou que la communauté n'a pas demandée, il y a du monde. Pour sortir des skins toutes les deux semaines à un prix absurde (je m'en fous, j'en achète pas), il y a du monde. Pour corriger les bugs (un Tueur non disponible pendant un mois etc.), il n'y a personne. Pour couronner le tout, quand il y a un problème majeur comme un bug qui impacte le jeu, les développeurs ont la bonne idée de nous passer des codes de points de sang (monnaie en jeu) pour "compenser" l'erreur de leur part. Ah bah c'est super ça !

- [b] La communauté. [/b] Pitié, c'est quoi ce truc ? Les survivants qui t'insultent en fin de partie parce qu'ils ne se sont pas échappés, les tueurs qui t'insultent parce que tu as fait une action qui ne va pas dans leur sens et j'en passe. "Ok, bah réduit la fenêtre du chat" - Oui donc mais il n'y a pas que ça en fait ! Les joueurs qui jouent n'importe comment, les joueurs qui ne veulent pas jouer, les joueurs qui se déconnectent pour des raisons ridicules ("oh non le tueur est sur moi, je vais me déconnecter"). Dans le jeu et hors du jeu, c'est vraiment infâme.

Après 700 heures, je me lasse du jeu, les décisions prises par les développeurs me déçoit (NFT financé par un DLC, financement d'un jeu de société par la communauté, une quantité importante de DLC etc.), la non-optimisation du jeu et les corrections tardives/inexistantes des bugs ruine mon expérience, la communauté me dégoûte. Que ce soit pour les anciens joueurs ayant abandonnés le navire et qui souhaitent revenir sur le jeu ou pour les nouveaux joueurs, [h1] je ne recommande pas Dead by Daylight. [/h1]

Ça sera tout, je vous remercie d'avoir lu mon évaluation !

Nice game in general, but as survivor in ranks 8-5 your are often getting killers who are rank 1-2 with mates from rank 3-9, not really balanced. Would be ok if the killer is skilled and entitled rank 1 rightful (and would win the match within ~5-10 min, so you can search another), but mainly in the past months, the killer rank 1 or 2 is "nooby" (for his rank) and wins totally undeserved (maybe one survives) against the, according to the game, "worse" survivors. I wish back the past times, when killers needed skill to get that high. Now many of them just play "noob" killer Freddy (who really doesnt require that much skill), taking your valuable lifetime to kill you in matches they didnt deserve related to how they win. Would be great if this would be revised.

Cher jeu, 
Je t'ai acheté en bonne et due forme, cependant, je sens comme de l'hostilité entre nous.
Il est vrai que j'ai pu vous insulté à plusieurs reprises, mais comprenez bien que c'était sous le coup de l'émotion et je n'en pensais pas un mot.
Il ne faut pas prendre au pied de la lettre toute ce que j'ai pu dire, la communauté que tu représentes peut-être perçue comme venant des égoûts, mais ça ne reflète pas ce que tu es.
Je sais qu'il y a du bon en toi, et je souhaiterais que l'on puisse repartir de zéro, avec des bases saines et pérennes.

En toute amitié,

After having 7250 hours in this game since it came out, I would have to say I like the game obviously. There are still issues with the game, even though I started out as a "Killer main", over time playing killer overall became less fun, and I would be considered a "Survivor main" now, but I still want to see the dev team give the killer more tools to end some chases quicker, also doing something about potential "infinite loops" that would occur if they took out Bloodlust as well, a lot of the current maps would have to be reworked to make this work.

As far as the community, I have streamed this game for many years and have met a lot of small and large streamers throughout my 4 1/2 years of playing and have made a lot of friends in the community. Obviously there are bad eggs out there (And some very toxic streamers too), if you want to avoid it however it is fairly easy since you can disable after game chat and just not watch streamers who you feel are "toxic".

My only other issue was something that happened to me personally with my Legacy when I lost my save file a few years ago, I was told in the email they sent that I would get bloodpoints to compensate the levels I lost, and I would eventually get my Legacy Trapper and Jake back. After they made all the rare cosmetics available for everyone (I actually had the very expensive Purple Ace Hat owned beforehand), they said they would not be giving anyone their legacy skins back, which upset me quite a bit as I now lost a unique item I had and was not getting the other back after being promised I would. It has always kind of left a bad taste in my mouth and as I work in a customer service industry, was definitely not handled properly, as I also had screenshots to prove my Legacy skins.

Sorry review went on a little longer than expected, so the TL:DR version is Overall: Good Game, always adding new content on a schedule which is nice and at least changing up perks every once in a while to spice things up is nice, upset a promise was broken about Legacy which meant a lot to me and takes my opinion of them down 1 notch.

I have been playing this game for three years, mainly on PS4. This game is genuinely amazing and I love to this day. I dislike the fact that this games theme is toxicity. It drives new players away from the game, and I really wish it didn't. Like many big and great games, the community has started to make it worse. If you dare to step foot in the subreddit you will see so many arguments it's not even comprehensible. The devs also don't fix some really annoying bugs and instead work on cosmetics and new killers which bring more problems to the game. This game is amazing, but the community could be a bit nicer. (I'm recommending the game itself.)

I consider this game to be pretty much a digital playground. Whether tryhard and sweat for the points or goof around and try to communicate solely through emotes, its usually a fun time.

Granted the balance in this game is quite erratic, and every patch can swing the powercreep in either the killers or the survivors direction. On top of that the balance changes drasticly depending on the players skill levels. It never really feels even.

Most of the DLC's content and cosmetics being unlockable through grinding is also a huge positive, but the fact that you can't unlock all of it that way is disappointing.
Also there's a battlepass which always leaves a bitter taste... but atleast you usually get back the currency invested into it by unlocking all tiers.

[b][u]tl;dr:[/u] its a great game to either jump into for a couple of rounds or even grind it out. Depending on how invested you are into the game there will be some frustrations, but in the end the pros outweight the cons.[/b]

This game has its host of problems and can be very fun, but this review is going to be targeted towards the monetization of the game. Also I am going to move very quickly so lets go.
The game is $20 and can be easily caught on a sale for $8. So its priced rather fairly. The catch is the in game purchases. It has a extreme grind to unlock perks which you will need to succeed, a battle pass, an in game store for cosmetics, and certain playable survivors and killers locked behind a paywall. This is outrageous for a payed game regardless of price. The developers highest priority is profit and its clear to see.
On a final note I will also add the game is a buggy mess and has very poor servers with some atrocious balancing.

Only buy this game if you are looking for something to goof around on with friends or if you have watched lots of game play and know the grindfest that wants to nickel and dime you at every corner.

This is a well made, uniquely stylized, competitively oriented, asymmetrical "horror" game. Tho the goal of this game, stopping survivors from repairing the 5 out of 7 generators or on the other side attempting to repair those 5 generators whilst being hunted by the killer is on the surface level quite good on it's own, but ultimately this game is about a cat chasing a mouse. And that is brilliant. Brilliant, because the game developers made sure that every cat and mouse would have a unique way of chasing each other.

[h1] And here's how they did it:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Introducing new Killers/Survivors/maps every 4 months with unique abilities and perks that spice up the game with every update. Thus making the game not stale and easy to pick up for new or returning players.
[*]Making said Killers have distinct powers and playstyles like ambush, stealth, ranged, zone-defense with different types of traps, etc.
[*]With new perks added to the game both competitive and casual players can match and create new builds that let them play in their own style.
[*]Having a high skill cap that keeps pushing players to become better than others sometimes leading to game changing revelations.
[*]Not to mention the best part of a successful game - it's replayable as hell. With every chase you think how to improve so next time you would last longer ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°).
[/list]

[h1]Unfortunately this game isn't perfect, here's why:[/h1]
[list]
[*]No idea why, but there still is no separate casual and competitive modes! Implementing these changes would fix crying about 
experienced players having to play with newcomers. Competitive players could rest easy knowing that casuals wouldn't interrupt them. 
[*]Sadly there are no statistics. Such as: 
escapes, percentage of victories, kills, escapes, heals, kills with the help of memento, pallet stuns, pallet drops, average playing time of specific Survivors or Killers, statistics of praise.
[*]Ranking system was not created for competitive play (i can't go deep in this discussion because it's a thread of it's own).
[/list]

[b]TLDR[/b]
If you are a competitive person this game should definitely be in your library. Putting aside all the secondary things (bs bugs and poor matchmaking/ranking system) this is a very satisfying game with a unique twist on a game of cat and mouse.
